question.text: At <math><msup><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">,</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> range of phenolphthalein is <math><mn>8</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>.</mo></math> At <math><msup><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>,</mo></math> <math><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow> </math> range of phenolphthalein would be -

options.text: <math> <mrow> <mtext>pH</mtext></mrow> </math> range remain unaffected by the temperature

solution.text: The <math> <mrow> <mtext>pH</mtext></mrow> </math> range of the indicator is <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>±</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo></math> On increase in temperature <math><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow></msub></math> decreases therefore <math> <mrow> <mtext>pH</mtext></mrow> </math> range of indicator decreases.
